%%spark
spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS clm_claim")
spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS clm_exposure")
spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS clm.claim")
spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS clm.exposure")
spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS claim")
spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS exposure")

%%pyspark
df = spark.read.option("delimiter", "|").load('abfss://trg@e2nprdadls01.dfs.core.windows.net/synapse/cc_TransParq/parquet/clm.Claim.parquet', format='parquet'
## If header exists uncomment line below
, header=True
)
df.write.mode("overwrite").saveAsTable("clm_Claim")
##display(df.limit(10))
df.printSchema()

%%pyspark
from pyspark.sql.functions import *
def slicer(my_str,sub):
   index=my_str.find(sub)
   if index !=-1 :
         return my_str[1+index:] 
   else :
         raise Exception('Sub string not found!')
####################################

src_name = ['clm.Claim','clm.Exposure']
for tables in src_name:   
    spark.sql("DROP TABLE IF EXISTS {slicer(tables,'.')}")
    loc = f"abfss://trg@e2nprdadls01.dfs.core.windows.net/synapse/cc_TransParq/parquet/{tables}.parquet"
    spark.sql(f"CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS {slicer(tables,'.')} USING PARQUET LOCATION '{loc}'")
